forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow. Cloudy, with a high near 30. Northeast wind around 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New snow accumulation of 3 to 7 inches possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow. Cloudy. Low around 20, with temperatures rising to around 28 overnight. Northeast wind 10 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New snow accumulation of 10 to 16 inches possible.

weather_report:
Boston finds itself cloaked in the heavy embrace of wintry weather this afternoon. A thick veil of clouds blankets the city, heralding a steady fall of snow that transforms the landscape into a soft, white expanse. With temperatures hovering near 30 degrees, the biting northeast wind serves as a reminder of winter's unforgiving grip. There's no mistaking the certainty of snowfall; the forecast promises an impressive accumulation that will blanket everything in a fresh layer of frost. 

As dusk approaches, temperatures will dip further, settling around a chilly 20 degrees before rising slightly overnight. The gusts of wind may carry an air of disquiet, pushing against windows and swirling snowflakes into delicate designs. As you navigate this cold tableau, dressing warmly becomes essential. A sturdy coat, perhaps a woolen scarf wrapped snugly around the neck, and a hat to guard against the chill are all wise choices. The muted palette outside may inspire quieter activities—perhaps a cozy afternoon spent with a good book by the window, watching the snowflakes dance, or venturing out to savor the stillness of the snow-covered streets. Embrace the tranquility of the moment; it’s one best spent savoring the simple joys winter has to offer.
